Richard CHATFIELD was born on 22 March 1862 in Whitechapel, London, England. He was christened on 20 April 1862 in Spitalfields Christ Church, Stepney, London, England. He appeared in the census in 1871 in New Town, Mile End, London, England. Richard lived in 28 Lindley St., Mile End, London, England in 1890. He lived in 31 Lindley St., Mile End, London, England in 1896. He died Cardiac Disease. on 11 October 1936 at the age of 74 in Stepney, London, England. Birth GRO 2nd qtr 1862

STOLEN CAR BURNED.

Auckland Star, Volume LVIII, Issue 233, 3 October 1927, Page 5

FOUND NEAR MANUKAU ROAD

Stolen from Mill Lane, off Symonds Street, about eight o'clock on Friday evening, a five-seater car, the property of Mr. Richard Albert Chatfield, of Wynyard Road, Mount Eden, was found burned in one of the new roads off Manukau Road, near the Wesleyan College, at 5:30 last evening.

I'm Ivy's grandaughter and have more info for you. Spouse of Alexander Ramage,

I've got no photos, but have other documents that might be of interest... naturalization originals, etc. His second wife was Hettie Cawan. Didn't know that she was an owner of a New Orleans newspaper. Never heard about a third wife. My mother and father spent a great deal of time with Gr. Grandfather Alexander - Alex. My father was named after him... and both my father and brother followed in his professional and intellectual pursuits. If you are looking for more, let's be in touch.

Parents: Alexander Sidney "Al \ Alec" CHATFIELD and Helen Mae REITER.Living (private). Parents: Raymond Cashous CHATFIELD and Living.

=====

Emigrated to USA 1852.

R. E. Chatfield, was a native of England and came to America as a young man. Here he married and moved westward to California; and in Sacramento he clerked for Gillig and Mott, pioneer hardware dealers. He later went to Virginia City, Nev., for Gillig and Company, a branch of the Sacramento house, and there he had charge of their warehouse both during the boom and the great fire. His next removal was to Reno, and there he died at the age of fifty-five.

He died on 21 April 1995 at the age of 79 in Orange Park, Clay Co., Florida, USA. He was buried in Cremated, ashes scattered on, Atlantic Ocean. Parents: Howard Edward HOTCHKISS - CHATFIELD and Bertha SWANAT. Rev Richard Louis "Tunney" CHATFIELD was born on 18 January 1922 in Palmyra, Marion Co., Missouri, USA. He appeared in the census in 1940 in Hannibal, Marion Co., Missouri, USA. He lived in St Louis Co., Missouri, USA in 1950. Tunney lived in 738 Frankford Rd., Louisiana, Pike Co., Missouri, USA in 1998. He died on 9 December 2012 at the age of 90 in Overland, St Louis Co., Missouri, USA. He was buried on 14 December 2012 in Mount Lebanon Cmtry., St Ann, St Louis Co., Missouri, USA. Tunney was a Christian Minister Seventh Day Church of God.. He was a Pounder at shoe factory.. Find A Grave Memorial# 102422074

-----

Life Legacy

Reverend Richard L. "Tunney" Chatfield, peacefully went home to be with his Lord and Savior on Sunday, December 9, 2012, surrounded by all those who loved him.

He was preceded in death by his wife of 68 years, Helen Sweetwood Chatfield; parents, Luama and Maggie Bagley Chatfield; two sisters, Angie Buddy and Lila Page; and two brothers, Jesse and Elmer Chatfield.

He is survived by his four children, Rosalie Whitworth and her husband, Clarence, of St. John, MO, Diane Jenkins and her husband, Tim, of Overland, MO, Richard Chatfield II and his wife, Louise, of Marthasville, MO, and Daniel Chatfield of Dallas, TX. He was a loving grandfather of eleven and great-grandfather of twelve, uncle, cousin and dear friend of many.

Reverend Chatfield held a Masters with the Missouri Chaplain Association of Divinity and a B.S. in Christian Counseling. He was a chaplain for the Metropolitan St. Louis Police Association and devoted his life to the ministry of our Lord as a minister of the Church of God Seventh Day for fifty years. He served our country honorably in the National Guard during World War II.

Friday, December 14 at 12:00pm. Graveside service and burial follow at Mount Lebanon Cemetery, 11101 St. Charles Rock Road, Saint Ann, MO.

Memorials given to his church, Church of God Seventh Day, 3301 Ashby Road, Saint Ann, MO 63074, are appreciated by his family.

Richard Norman CHATFIELD Jr was born on 9 June 1957 in Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio, USA. He died on 5 October 2014 at the age of 57 in Toledo, Lucas Co., Ohio, USA. He was buried on 11 October 2014. Richard "Rick" N. Chatfield Jr., 57, entered the Kingdom of Heaven on October 5, 2014. He was born to Richard N. Chatfield Sr. and Phyllis C. Chatfield, on June 9, 1957, in Toledo, Ohio. Richard loved spending time with his beloved family, and dogs. He also enjoyed watching NASCAR and working on projects in his garage.

Surviving is his wife of 33 years, Mary Grace (Milton) Chatfield; sister, Jacqueline Watson; brothers, Daniel (Jackie) Chatfield, and Clarence (Darlene) Chatfield; nieces, Heather (Craig), Sara, and Staci; nephews, Jason, Ronald (Rica), and Matthew Jr.; great-niece, Madison; great-nephews, Daegan and Jaxon. He is preceded in death by his parents; in-laws, Frank and Sarah Milton, and sister, Mary Beth Chatfield.

Family and friends are invited to attend a funeral mass on October 11, 2014, starting at 10 a.m. at St. Charles Borromeo Catholic Church, 1842 Airport Highway, Toledo, Ohio, 43609. In lieu of flowers, please donate to the family.

May he rest in peace with the angels and saints.

Toledo Blade - Toledo, OH - 9 Oct 2014
